body_html:
I also failed to build due to this file. The first line:
!/usr/bin/env python
assumes that the default python is the version that we are using to build. On CentOS7, I have 2 python2.7 versions side-by-side, and I wanted to build using the not-default version. However, this line used the default python2.7 which caused an error importing argparse. Can we change this invocation to use the python specified by ./configure ?

body:
I also failed to build due to this file. The first line:
    !/usr/bin/env python
assumes that the default python is the version that we are using to build. On CentOS7, I have 2 python2.7 versions side-by-side, and I wanted to build using the not-default version. However, this line used the default python2.7 which caused an error importing argparse. Can we change this invocation to use the python specified by ./configure ?
